title: Tom Stoppard
summary: Sir Tom Stoppard OM CBE FRSL HonFBA (born Tomáš Sträussler; 3 July 1937) is a Czech-born British playwright and screenwriter.[1] He has written for television, radio, film, and stage, finding prominence with plays such as Arcadia, The Coast of Utopia, Every Good Boy Deserves Favour, Professional Foul, The Real Thing, Travesties, The Invention of Love, and Rosencrantz and Guildenstern Are Dead.
